summary: The "Improving Care and Access to Nurses Act" (I CAN Act) aims to expand access to healthcare services provided by advanced practice registered nurses (APRNs). The bill amends titles XVIII and XIX of the Social Security Act, focusing on removing barriers to practice for nurse practitioners, certified registered nurse anesthetists, and certified nurse-midwives. Key provisions include expanding access to various Medicare and Medicaid services, clarifying reimbursement rules, reforming supervision requirements, and improving training opportunities.
